intro: Spergulastrum lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, arranged in dense clusters at the tips of the stems. Spergulastrum lanceolatum plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
